[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@amadeus-it-group/kassette](./kassette.md) &gt; [CLIConfigurationSpec](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.md)

## CLIConfigurationSpec interface

The set of possible properties defined through the CLI (it is reduced since it can't contain runtime values)

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface CLIConfigurationSpec 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [delay?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.delay.md) | [Delay](./kassette.delay.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> The default delay. |
|  [hostname?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.hostname.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> The hostname on which the proxy should listen. Uses <code>127.0.0.1</code> by default, which only allows local connections. To allow remote connections, use the ip address of the specific network interface that should be allowed to connect or the unspecified IPv4 (<code>0.0.0.0</code>) or IPv6 (<code>::</code>) address. |
|  [mocksFolder?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.mocksfolder.md) | string | <i>(Optional)</i> The default root folder of all mocks, from which specific mocks paths will be resolved. |
|  [mode?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.mode.md) | [Mode](./kassette.mode.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> The default mode. |
|  [port?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.port.md) | number | <i>(Optional)</i> The port on which the proxy should listen. Note that kassette accepts both http and https connections on this port. |
|  [proxyConnectMode?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.proxyconnectmode.md) | [ProxyConnectMode](./kassette.proxyconnectmode.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> Default mode for <code>CONNECT</code> requests. |
|  [remoteURL?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.remoteurl.md) | string \| null | <i>(Optional)</i> The URL of the remote backend, from which only the protocol, hostname and port are used. Can be left <code>null</code>, in which case anything leading to sending the request to the remote backend will trigger an exception. Can also contain the special <code>&quot;*&quot;</code> value, which means reading from the request the remote backend to target. This is useful when using kassette as a browser proxy. |
|  [skipLog?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.skiplog.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> If true, will simplify the logging output, logging only one line when the request is received but nothing else afterwards. |
|  [tlsCAKeyPath?](./kassette.cliconfigurationspec.tlscakeypath.md) | string \| null | <i>(Optional)</i> Path to a PEM-encoded CA (Certificate Authority) certificate and key file, created if it does not exist. If not provided, the certificate and key are generated but only kept in memory. This certificate and key are used as needed to sign certificates generated on the fly for any HTTPS connection intercepted by kassette. |
